page.title: 17Maltkiln Farm, Eccleston
page.content: Mrs Quigg, the farmer, comes from a family which has farmed in this area for four generations. Her husband works in the industrial building industry, but helps on the farm in his spare time. Like his father before him, he has worked as a blacksmith. Mrs Quigg has an evening job, teaching fashion and design at evening classes. Maltkiln Farm is a beef farm, begun by her when they moved there. At present she has 100 cattle, but aims to have 200. She buys cross-bred calves when they are 1 week old, feeding them initially on dried milk powder. When they are between 14 and 20 months old she sells them, at Wigan, Chelford or Beeston cattle markets. The only time extra help is employed is at hay-making time.
